alert.note: Alert for Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 10:04PM PDT until August 20 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Fresno and Tulare. * WHEN...Until 100 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1004 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.8 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Upper Tyndall Creek, Tyndall Creek Ranger Station, Roaring River Ranger Station, Bearpaw Ranger Station, Charlotte Lakes Ranger Station, Chagoopa Plateau, Little Five Lakes Ranger Station, Charlotte Lake, Crabtree Ranger Station, Crabtree Meadow, Pear Lake Ranger Station, Rae Lakes Ranger Station, Moraine Campground, Canyon View Campground, Sentinel Campground, Cedar Grove, Rock Creek Ranger Station, Mitchell Meadow, Sheep Creek Campground and Monarch Ranger Station. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
